intro: Erigeron myosotis f. spithameus, commonly known as the Spithameus fleabane, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world. The inflorescence consists of both ray and disk flowers, which attract various pollinators.
